steps.title: Balance and grounding
steps.content: Balance and grounding Black agate heals the root chakra , which is associated with your sense of safety and security. Because of this, black agate is the perfect crystal in times of uncertainty or stress. It stabilizes, balances, and grounds you, so you can remain solid even in chaotic situations. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Courage, self-confidence, & prosperity
steps.content: Courage, self-confidence, & prosperity Black agate calms anxieties and boosts feelings of self-assuredness. This makes it a powerful crystal to use when you need to face your fears. It helps you banish self-doubt and cultivate a fearless mindset when you’re taking on a daunting task. [2] X Research source And, when you approach life with this attitude, victory and prosperity tend to follow!

steps.title: Protection against negative energy
steps.content: Protection against negative energy Black agate can cleanse your mind of negative thoughts and emotions, and it also protects you from external negative energies. This makes black agate is a great crystal for getting through tough times, navigating major life changes, and letting go of things that no longer serve you. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Emotional & Mental Properties
steps.content: Emotional & Mental Properties Many people believe that black agate can promote mental and emotional well-being. It's thought to soothe worries, banish negative thoughts, and promote a healthy, balanced mindset. As a result, black agate may be helpful for those who struggle with stress, anxiety, or depression. [4] X Research source Black agate can be a great supplementary tool, but it should not be used as a substitute for mental healthcare. If you’ve been struggling with your mental health, seek out treatment with a therapist or counselor. Ask a friend or family member for a referral, or check online directories to find the right therapist for you. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Psychological Association Leading scientific and professional organization of licensed psychologists Go to source

steps.title: Physical Healing Properties
steps.content: Physical Healing Properties Those who practice crystal healing use black agate to ease digestive issues, such as nausea, cramps, and upset stomach. [6] X Research source Black agate is also thought to soothe headaches, dental issues, and joint pain. [7] X Research source Remember, crystal healing should not be used as a substitute for medical treatment! Be sure to talk to your doctor if you’re experiencing symptoms of an illness or injury.

steps.title: Wear it as jewelry.
steps.content: Wear it as jewelry. This is an easy (and stylish!) way to harness the powers of black agate. [8] X Research source Luckily, black agate looks lovely on necklaces , bracelets , and rings , so you have lots of options to choose from to fit your personal style. Caring for black agate jewelry: If your jewelry gets dirty, you can gently cleanse it with a soft cloth and soapy water, but avoid harsh chemicals. [9] X Research source Fully dry your jewelry after washing, and store in a cool, dry place. [10] X Research source If you don’t wear jewelry, you can also carry a small black agate stone in your pocket to enjoy the same effects.

steps.title: Place it in your home or office.
steps.content: Place it in your home or office. To increase self-confidence, promote balance, and protect against negative vibes, display a black agate crystal in your home, or place one on your desk at your workplace. It serves as a stylish decorative accent while also fortifying you with spiritual protection! [11] X Research source

steps.title: Meditate with it.
steps.content: Meditate with it. Many people meditate with crystals to experience their healing effects. Hold a black agate stone in your hand as you meditate to dispel negative energies and balance your root chakra. [12] X Research source You can also place the black agate directly on your root chakra (at the base of your spine) to activate it while you meditate.

steps.title: Cleanse it regularly.
steps.content: Cleanse it regularly. To cleanse and purify black agate, light a bundle of sage or palo santo and let the smoke envelop the stone. This clears away any negative vibrations. You can also leave your stone under a full moon for the night or place it on top of a bed of Himalayan salt for several hours. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Recharge it.
steps.content: Recharge it. Just like batteries, crystals need to be refueled every once in a while. You can recharge your black agate by placing it under running water, or bathing it under moonlight. [14] X Research source You can also charge your black agate with a specific intention. Hold the stone in your hands and visualize your intention (protection, balance, courage, etc). Channel this energy into the stone. This programs your black agate with a specific, personalized purpose. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Store it properly.
steps.content: Store it properly. Keep your black agate crystal in a cool, dry place, apart from any abrasive materials that might scratch or damage it. [16] X Research source Be sure to dry it thoroughly after getting it wet, and avoid too much direct exposure to sunlight to keep its color from fading. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Agate was named by the ancient Greek philosopher, Theophrastus.
steps.content: Agate was named by the ancient Greek philosopher, Theophrastus. Theophrastus discovered these beautiful stones near the Achates River in Sicily. This was considered a momentous discovery, and agate came to be used to ward off evil, soothe injuries, and ensure victory in war. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Black agate was used in traditional Chinese medicine.
steps.content: Black agate was used in traditional Chinese medicine. According to traditional Chinese medicine, any imbalance to one’s Qi (vital life force) would result in disease or illness. [19] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Black agate was thought to energize one’s Qi, making it a powerful force for health and healing. [20] X Research source

steps.title: In medieval Europe, black agate adorned jewelry and religious objects.
steps.content: In medieval Europe, black agate adorned jewelry and religious objects. The stone was used for items like signet rings and rosaries, and it was therefore associated with authority and power. The stone continued to be used and studied throughout Europe in the 17th, 18th, and 19th centuries. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Black agate is a quartz crystal.
steps.content: Black agate is a quartz crystal. It's classified as a chalcedony, or a crystalline form of quartz. [22] X Research source Chemical classification: Mineral Chemical composition: Silicon dioxide (SiO2 ) Hardness: 6.5-7 on Mohs scale Density: 2.58-2.64 Location: Found worldwide Types of Agate: Dendritic agate, lace agate, Botswana agate, fire agate [23] X Research source
